intro: Raspalia oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf raspalia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often blooming during the rainy season. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds. Raspalia oblongifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth and along stream banks.
